class.name: Shortcut
class.description: A shortcut for binding input. Shortcuts are commonly used for interacting with a [Control] element from a [InputEvent].

method.name: get_as_text
method.argument: Returns result for the primary shortcut if [code]true[/code], or secondary shortcut if [code]false[/code].

method.name: get_shortcut
method.argument: Returns result for the primary shortcut if [code]true[/code], or secondary shortcut if [code]false[/code].
method.description: The shortcut's [InputEvent]. See also [member primary_shortcut] and member [member secondary_shortcut].

method.name: is_shortcut
method.argument: If [code]true[/code], it will check for matches on both the primary and secondary shortcuts. If [code]false[/code], it will use the third paramter to determine which shorcut to check agaisnt.
This argument is only used if [code]matches_either[/code] is [code]false[/code]. Returns result for the primary shortcut if [code]true[/code], or secondary shortcut if [code]false[/code].

method.name: is_valid
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the primary or secondary shortcut is valid.

method.name: set_shortcut
method.argument: The [InputEvent] to set the shortcut to.
Sets the event for the primary shortcut if [code]true[/code], or secondary shortcut if [code]false[/code].
method.description: Sets the shortcut's [InputEvent]. See also [member primary_shortcut] and member [member secondary_shortcut].

members.member: The primary shortcut's [InputEvent]. Generally the [InputEvent] is a keyboard key, though it can be any [InputEvent].
The secondary shortcut's [InputEvent]. Generally the [InputEvent] is a keyboard key, though it can be any [InputEvent].
